messages.content: LoRTnoC-ComfyUI is a repository for using LoRTnoC (LoRA with hint block of ControlNet) on ComfyUI.
Where should the model files for LoRTnoC-ComfyUI be placed?
The model files for LoRTnoC-ComfyUI should be placed in the same location as the ControlNet files.
What does the example workflow in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI repository demonstrate?

The example workflow in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI repository demonstrates the generation of images using various reference methods such as canny, depth, hed, fake_scribble, lineart_anime, and pose(cherry pick).
What is the purpose of the canny reference method in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI example?
The canny reference method in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI example is used to generate images based on edge detection.
How is the depth reference method used in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI example?
The depth reference method in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI example is used to generate images based on depth information.
What does the hed reference method in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI example stand for?
The hed reference method in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI example stands for Holistically-Nested Edge Detection, which is used for generating images.
What is the purpose of the fake_scribble reference method in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI example?
The fake_scribble reference method in the LoRTnoC-ComfyUI example is used to generate images based on simulated hand-drawn scribbles.
